tourBios.carHigh:
2012: Was one of four players to start all 27 events during the year. Made the cut 19 times, second-best on Tour, but had only a pair of top-10 finishes...Opened with rounds of 68-68 to eventually T9 at the Panama Claro Championship. Weekend scores of 73-72 dropped him back in the standings...Also T9 at the WNB Golf Classic in September...Ranked No. 10 in Putts Per Round for the year. 

2011: Made the cut in 15 of 23 starts on the Web.com Tour. Made six cuts in a row from mid-June into early August...First top 10 was a T8 at the Mylan Classic in early September...Added a T6 finish a couple weeks later at the Soboba Golf Classic, where his 11-under finish left him three shots back of the leaders. Ended the week with 96 putts, one shy of the Tour's all-time record for fewest putts in 72 holes (Grant Waite, 95, 2003 Miccosukee Championship)...Made a run at the top 60 and a Web.com Tour Championship spot at the final full-field event, the Winn-Dixie Jacksonville Open. A final-round 75 dropped him into a T11 finish and 63rd position on the final money list. 

2010: Played on a Major Medical Extension on the PGA TOUR. Had 12 events to earn $365,675 (coupled with $297,008 in 2009). Netted $160,706 in 15 events. Also played in three Web.com Tour tournaments, missing the cut in each. 

2009: Made 14 starts with one top-10 finish, but was forced to sit out the rest of the PGA TOUR season beginning in June when he required surgery for a torn ligament in his right thumb. Returned to action in late November at the JBWere Australian Masters, where he finished T17. Played his way into the final pairing at the Verizon Heritage in April with a third-round, 6-under 65, but struggled Sunday with a 2-over 73. Still managed a T6 finish, the best by a left-hander at the tournament since Phil Mickelson finished third in 2002.

2008: One of 14 rookies to come out of the 2007 PGA TOUR Qualifying Tournament...Collected the first top-10 of his PGA TOUR career with a T6 finish at the inaugural Puerto Rico Open...Finished third at the Zurich Classic of New Orleans after falling two strokes shy of winner Andres Romero...Four rounds in the 60s led to a career-best, runner-up finish to Zach Johnson at the Valero Texas Open, worth a career-best $336,000. 

2007: Was T14 at the PGA TOUR Qualifying Tournament, where a final-round 68 helped him move up from T25 entering the last day and earn his card for 2008...Enjoyed a consistent year on the Web.com Tour, making 23 cuts in 26 starts. Finished No. 49 on the money list, with $133,222. Ended the season with 12 top-25s, but managed to crack the top-10 on just two occasions...Began the year with a season-best T7 at the Movistar Panama Championship...Finished T9 at the Knoxville Open.

2006: Made the cut in 13 of 25 starts on the Web.com Tour, with five top-25s. Concluded the season No. 73 on the money list, with $75,676. Shot a 7-under 65, highlighted by a Tour season-best eight consecutive birdies on Nos. 7-14, to share the first-round lead with Matt Hendrix at the Knoxville Open. Went on to finish T19...Shared the 54-hole lead with Ricky Barnes at the Oregon Classic, before finishing in third place-his only top-10 of the seasonâ€”and just one shot out of the Barnes-Cliff Kresge playoff. 

2005: Made the cut in 12 of 25 starts during his rookie season on the Web.com Tour, with four top-10s. Wrapped up the season No. 49 on the money list, with $109,275. First two top-10 showings of the season were both T9 outings at the BMW Charity Pro-Am at The Cliffs and the Preferred Health Systems Wichita Open. Also cracked the top 10 at the Envirocare Utah Classic (T7) and the weather-shortened Oregon Classic, with a season-best T2 outing. Would have entered the last round in Oregon three shots behind leader Jeff Gove before rain forced the shortening of the tournament. 

2004: Made six starts on the Web.com Tour during the season, making the cut in two, a T5 at the Miccosukee Championship and T7 at the Knoxville Open. Made one start on the PGA TOUR, picking up $29,820 with a T27 at the Buick Championship. Moved up 37 places on the final day on the strength of a 6-under 64. 2003: Made the cut at the Deutsche Bank Championship, his first PGA TOUR start. Has also played on the Australasian Tour.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Winner of the 2000 New Zealand Amateur.
tourBios.personal: Favorite course to play is St. Andrews...Says his superstitions are "Whatever worked the day before." Favorite TV show is "South Park" and "Once Were Warriors" is his favorite movie. Dave Chappelle is his favorite entertainer. Enjoys watching track and field. New York, London and Washington, D.C., are his favorite cities to visit and Coromandel, New Zealand is his favorite vacation spot...Learned the game by hitting a 6-iron around the playground at his old school. First broke par at age 15.

tourBios.carHigh:
2014-15: Made just eight cuts in 28 starts, with a T22 at the RBC Canadian Open marking his lone top-25 finish. Ended the season No. 184 in the FedExCup standings...In the Web.com Tour Finals, made all four cuts. Finished T22 and T56 in Fort Wayne and Charlotte before collecting a T9 at the Nationwide Children's Hospital Championship in Columbus, Ohio. Was 19th on the Finals' money list entering the finale at Web.com Tour Championship. Solidied his position and card with a T24 at TPC Sawgrass. Was 40th on the final priority-ranking order.

2013-14: Made 18 of 25 cuts on TOUR, while matching his career-best total of three top-10s. Ended his season by missing the 54-hole cut at The Barclays to finish a career-best 119th in the FedExCup standings. Only other start in the FedExCup Playoffs was in 2008...Finished T10 at the OHL Classic at Mayakoba for his first top-10 on PGA TOUR since the 2009 season...Rounds of 67-72-69 led to playing in the final group at the AT&T Pebble Beach National Pro-Am with eventual champion Jimmy Walker. Turned in a 1-over 73 on the final day to finish T7, five behind Walker's winning score...At the Barracuda Championship, point totals of 16-5-1-12 in the Modified Stableford scoring event resulted in a T8 with three others. Followed three consecutive birdies on Nos. 3-5 in the first round with five consecutive on Nos. 10-14.

2013: Completed his season making 14 Web.com Tour cuts in 19 starts, which included a Tour-equaling-best runner-up in May...Was among the Tour's most consistent performers, particulary in the first half of the year...Finished T6 at the Chitimacha Louisiana Open, five shots back of winner Edward Loar...Was T10 at the Brasil Classic in Sao Paulo two weeks later, thanks to four sub-70 scores...Runner-up to Brendon Todd at the weather-shortened Stadion Classic at UGA in early May, matching his career-best finish, which also came at a rain-shortened, 54-hole event (2005 Oregon Classic)...Fired a third-round, 6-under 66 in the Mexico Championship to finish in fifth place...Moved from No. 10 to No. 4 on the money list...Continued his solid play with a solo 10th-place finish at the Mid-Atlantic Championship a week later. Moved into contention at TPC Potomac at Avenel Farm with a 5-under 65 in the third round. Failed to muster a charge on the final day. Effort outside Washington, D.C. was his seventh top-15 finish in eight starts and moved him up one spot, to No. 3, on the money list...Took a share of the first-round lead at the News Sentinel Open in mid-August after opening with a 6-under 65. Played his middle two rounds in 3-under, then rebounded nicely with a Sunday 66 that included no bogeys, three birdies and an eagle. Finished T6 in Knoxville...Ended the season 10th in earnings to secure his 2013-14 PGA TOUR card...Continued his steady play in the Finals, with T24 and T14 finishes, respectively, in the Hotel Fitness Championship and Chiquita Classic.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR in 2016 is T21st at the Puerto Rico Open at Coco Beach.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks T37th in Scoring Average (Actual) on the PGA TOUR.
